Menjelang Munas Golkar, Persaingan Airlangga-Bamsoet Mulai Panas
04 Nov 2019, 01:27 by Budiarti Utami Putri, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ketua Bidang Media dan Penggalangan Opini DPP Partai Golkar Ace Hasan Syadzily mengingatkan Bambang Soesatyo atau Bamsoet mengenai komitmennya tak maju sebagai calon ketua umum di musyawarah nasional atau Munas Golkar Desember mendatang. Ace mengatakan sebagai pemimpin Bamsoet semestinya berpegang pada komitmen itu.
"Mengingatkan kembali komitmen itu. Integritas seorang pemimpin dinilai dari konsistensi dan memegang teguh komitmen," kata Ace kepada Tempo, Ahad malam, 3 November 2019.
Menurut Ace, Bamsoet pernah menyampaikan komitmen itu setidaknya dua kali di hadapan publik. Kader beringin, kata dia, melihat dan mendengar pernyataan Bambang yang menyatakan mendukung Ketua Umum Golkar inkumben Airlangga Hartarto untuk kembali menjadi ketua umum di munas mendatang. "Kami yakin Pak Bamsoet akan memegang komitmen seperti yang pernah disampaikan oleh beliau," ujarnya.
Ace mengaku belum mendengar langsung dari Bambang mengenai keinginannya tetap maju sebagai caketum Golkar. Meski begitu, sejumlah loyalis Bambang menyatakan ketua Majelis Permusyawaratan Rakyat itu akan tetap mencalonkan diri.
Wakil Koordinator Bidang Kepartaian DPP Partai Golkar Darul Siska mengatakan Bambang akan tetap maju karena dorongan dari pengurus partai di tingkat daerah. Dia mengklaim, para pengurus daerah ingin Bambang memimpin pemenangan partai di pilkada dan pemilu mendatang. "Beliau menyatakan siap untuk maju karena memang didorong oleh pimpinan kabupaten, kota, provinsi," kata Darul kepada Tempo, Ahad malam, 3 November 2019.
Darul mengklaim, Bambang saat ini sudah mengantongi dukungan lebih separuh pemilik suara di musyawarah nasional. Merujuk Anggaran Dasar/Anggaran Rumah Tangga DPP Partai Golkar, ada 560 pemilik suara sah dalam munas. Pemilik suara sah ini ialah 34 Dewan Pimpinan Daerah tingkat I (provinsi), 514 DPD tingkat II (kabupaten/kota), 1 suara DPP, 1 suara Dewan Pembina, dan 10 ormas sayap partai.
"Jumlahnya signifikan untuk memenangkan munas yang akan datang," kata dia, enggan merinci jumlah tepatnya dukungan yang sudah dikantongi Bambang.
Menurut Darul, para pendukung menganggap komitmen Bambang dengan Airlangga adalah persoalan antara mereka berdua. Peserta munas, kata dia, yang pada akhirnya akan menentukan peran kedua orang itu. "Kekuasaan di Golkar itu bukan milik mereka berdua. Bukan milik Airlangga bukan milik Bamsoet, tapi ada di Munas Golkar."
Selasa besok, 5 November 2019, DPP Golkar akan menggelar rapat pleno yang mengagendakan rapat pimpinan nasional dan munas. Menurut Ketua DPP Partai Golkar Elvis Junaedi mengatakan, rapimnas akan digelar pada 7 November, adapun Munas diagendakan pada 3-5 Desember.
text:
Ahead of Golkar National Conference, Airlangga-Bamsoet Competition Starts Hot
04 Nov 2019, 01:27 by Budiarti Utami Putri, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Chairman of the Media and Gathering Party of the Golkar Party DPP Ace Hasan Syadzily reminded Bambang Soesatyo or Bamsoet of his commitment not to advance as a candidate for chairman in the national assembly or the Golkar National Conference next December. Ace said that as the leader of Bamsoet, he must hold on to that commitment.
"Recalling that commitment. The integrity of a leader is judged by consistency and upholding the commitment," Ace told Tempo on Sunday night, November 3, 2019.
According to Ace, Bamsoet had conveyed that commitment at least twice before the public. The cadre of the banyan, he said, saw and heard Bambang's statement that said he supported the incumbent Golkar Chairperson Airlangga Hartarto to return to become the general chairperson in the coming general assembly. "We are sure that Mr Bamsoet will keep the commitments as stated by him," he said.
Ace claimed not to have heard directly from Bambang about his desire to keep moving forward as a Golkar caketum. Even so, a number of Bambang's loyalists said the chairman of the People's Consultative Assembly would continue to run for office.
Golkar Party DPP Party Deputy Coordinator Darul Siska said Bambang would continue to advance due to encouragement from party officials at the regional level. He claimed, regional administrators wanted Bambang to lead the party's victory in the elections and the upcoming elections. "He said he was ready to go forward because he was indeed encouraged by the leadership of the regency, city, province," Darul told Tempo, Sunday night, November 3, 2019.
Darul claims, Bambang currently has the support of more than half of the voters in the national deliberations. Referring to the Statutes / Bylaws of the Golkar Party DPP, there were 560 legitimate voters in the General Assembly. The legitimate vote holders are 34 Regional Leadership Councils (provincial), 514 DPD level II (regencies / cities), 1 DPP vote, 1 Board of Trustees vote, and 10 party wing organizations.
"The number is significant to win the upcoming General Assembly," he said, reluctant to specify the exact amount of support Bambang had pocketed.
According to Darul, the supporters considered Bambang's commitment to Airlangga to be a problem between the two of them. Munas participants, he said, would ultimately determine the roles of the two men. "The power in Golkar does not belong to the two of them. It does not belong to Airlangga, it does not belong to Bamsoet, but it belongs to the Golkar National Conference."
Next Tuesday, November 5, 2019, the Golkar DPP will hold a plenary meeting that will convene a meeting of national and parliamentary leaders. According to Golkar Party DPP Chairman Elvis Junaedi said rapimnas would be held on November 7, while the National Conference was scheduled for 3-5 December.
